summary: This is an email from the Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force announcing an ECPAT USA virtual discussion about the documentary "Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich." It includes details about the event panelists and registration information, highlighting the organization's mission to combat child sexual exploitation.

persons.name: Lisa Bryant
persons.context: Featured as a director in the ECPAT USA discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein documentary.

persons.name: Kathryn Stamoulis
persons.context: Featured as a psychologist in the ECPAT USA discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein documentary.

persons.name: Fernando Camacho
persons.context: Featured as an ECPAT-USA board member in the discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein documentary.

persons.name: Lori L. Cohen
persons.context: Moderating the ECPAT USA discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein documentary.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the documentary discussion; described as using wealth and power to carry out abuses.

events.title: ECPAT USA Discussion on Jeffrey Epstein Documentary
events.description: A virtual Zoom presentation and discussion about the documentary "Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich," featuring director Lisa Bryant, psychologist Kathryn Stamoulis, and board member Fernando Camacho, moderated by Lori L. Cohen.

keyFacts: ECPAT USA hosted a discussion about the documentary "Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich" on July 8, 2020.
The event featured experts including a director, psychologist, and board member, moderated by ECPAT-USA's Executive Director.
The documentary examines how Jeffrey Epstein used his wealth and power to carry out sexual abuses.
The email originated from the Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating official interest in the Epstein case.
ECPAT-USA's mission is to protect children from sexual exploitation and trafficking, linking the discussion to broader anti-trafficking efforts.
